co.cask.cdap.api.data.stream

Class StreamBatchReadable

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.cdap.api.data.stream.StreamBatchReadable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BatchReadable<Long,String>

    public class StreamBatchReadable
extends Object
implements BatchReadable<Long,String>
    This class is for using a Stream as input for a MapReduce program.

    An instance of this class should be set in the MapReduceContext of the beforeSubmit method to use the Stream as input: 

    
   class MyMapReduce implements MapReduce {
       public void beforeSubmit(MapReduceContext context) {
         context.setInput(new StreamBatchReadable("mystream"));
       }
   }

      • StreamBatchReadable

        public StreamBatchReadable(URI uri)
        Creates a StreamBatchReadable with the given URI. The URI should be of the form: 
        stream://<stream_name>[?start=<start_time>[&end=<end_time>[&decoder=<decoderClass>[&bodyFormat=<bodyFormat>]]]]

    • Method Detail

      • useStreamInput

        public static void useStreamInput(MapReduceContext context,
                  String streamName)
        Specifies to use the given stream as input of a MapReduce job. Same as calling useStreamInput(context, streamName, 0L, Long.MAX_VALUE)

      • useStreamInput

        public static void useStreamInput(MapReduceContext context,
                  String streamName,
                  long startTime,
                  long endTime)
        Specifies to use the given stream as input of a MapReduce job.

        The Mapper or Reducer class that reads from the Stream needs to have the KEYIN type as LongWritable, which will carry timestamp of the StreamEvent.

        The VALUEIN type can be BytesWritable or Text. For Text value type, the StreamEvent body will be decoded as UTF-8 String.

        Parameters:
        context - The context of the MapReduce job
        streamName - Name of the stream
        startTime - Start timestamp in milliseconds (inclusive) of stream events provided to the job
        endTime - End timestamp in milliseconds (exclusive) of stream events provided to the job

      • useStreamInput

        public static void useStreamInput(MapReduceContext context,
                  String streamName,
                  long startTime,
                  long endTime,
                  Class<? extends StreamEventDecoder> decoderType)
        Specifies to use the given stream as input of a MapReduce job, with a custom StreamEventDecoder to decode StreamEvent into key/value pairs.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the MapReduce job
        streamName - Name of the stream
        startTime - Start timestamp in milliseconds (inclusive) of stream events provided to the job
        endTime - End timestamp in milliseconds (exclusive) of stream events provided to the job
        decoderType - The StreamEventDecoder class for decoding StreamEvent

      • useStreamInput

        public static void useStreamInput(MapReduceContext context,
                  String streamName,
                  long startTime,
                  long endTime,
                  FormatSpecification bodyFormatSpec)
        Specifies to use the given stream as input of a MapReduce job, using the given FormatSpecification describing how to read the body of a stream. Using this method means your mapper must use a mapreduce LongWritable as the map key and GenericStreamEventData as the map value.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the MapReduce job
        streamName - Name of the stream
        startTime - Start timestamp in milliseconds (inclusive) of stream events provided to the job
        endTime - End timestamp in milliseconds (exclusive) of stream events provided to the job
        bodyFormatSpec - The FormatSpecification describing how the stream body should be read
